intro: Pilosella pseudothaumasia, commonly known as the alpine hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular florets, typical of the genus Pilosella. It thrives in rocky and sandy soils at high altitudes, often in open, sun-exposed areas. Pilosella pseudothaumasia is notable for its delicate appearance and its ability to withstand harsh mountainous environments.
